column4: Do you have an idea why the vboxdrv module is not compiled here?  Or does it even have a different name now?  I looked around with modprobe and in /etc/init.d/ but found nothing obviously fixing the issue for me.
there is a command you can run to force it to recompile (it tells you it if you try and use it and the correct version isn't compiled already)
possibly in dmesg
Well, that's the thing. I'm looking for that command, but can't find it.
sudo invoke-rc.d vboxdrv setup
Are you on Jaunty?
ya
virtualbox from sun, not community wotsit edition

I'm getting the feeling I'm missing a package here.  "locate vbox.drv" returns nothing here.  And I just stumbled upon an interesting log entry.  /var/log/vbox-install.log:/etc/init.d/virtualbox-ose: line 283: /usr/lib/virtualbox/src/vboxdrv/build_in_tmp: No such file or directory
googling for that error suggests to me there is something wrong with the Debian/Ubuntu packages
relative/absolute path problems
oh ok. are you on Jaunty as well? I've not had any problems as far as I can remember (apart from having to force it to recompile a couple of times)
yes, I'm on Jaunty.  Jaunty has version 2.1.4 and according to Debian's bugtracker, this problem was fixed only in 2.2.2: http://bugs.debian.org/526322
Probably we need a backport of the fix.  Strange that apparently not many other people are affected (or they gave up)
ah, I'm not using the version from the repositories, I'm using a deb downloaded from the vbox site
yes, you're lucky ;-)
is the bug reported in Launchpad too?
I'm checking at the moment and inspecting the ChangeLogs, but haven't found anything definitive, et
Do you have a file /etc/init.d/vboxdrv?  If so, can you please tell me what package is returned from "dpkg -S /etc/init.d/vboxdrv"?
virtualbox-2.2
thanks.  I can only assume then that /etc/init.d/virtualbox-ose is the equivalent
I have concluded that the jaunty package has many issues.  Rather than fixing them, I will recompile the karmic version and use that.  2.2.x seems to be a major leap in stability.
sounds sensible :)
